Procedure for unloading of TT at RO
- Park TT on horizontal surface for setting for about 10 minutes.
- Ensure that ignition switch is in OFF position.
- Connect the earthing wire with TT.
- Check the compartment and button manifold and the safety valve compartment are securely locked with tamper proof security locks.

- Check the dip rod, proof level and the product height marking with the mentioned in the valid calibration certificate available with the tank lorry driver with a standard measuring tape having graduations in mm.
- Check if the dip rod is carrying the seal and validity of stamping at the bottom, proof level and at the product level.
- Check the product loaded in the compartments with challan.
- Open the safety valve and check dip of each compartment.
- In case of shortage, top up each compartment up to the product level indicated on the dip rod through a calibrated measure.
- Record the shortage on the challan and obtain acknowledgement from the driver on all copies, including the location copy.
- Draw composite samples from the manifold and check foe density.
- In case density matches within allowable limits, position the tank truck to unload the product near the corresponding tank.
- Ensure that there is no traffic in the vicinity of the truck to unload the product near the corresponding tank.
- Place the fire safety buckets and fire Extinguishers in readiness before commencement of unloading at the retail outlet.
- Ensure proper bonding of the truck with the unloading pipe.
- Use cam lock coupling to connect the underground pipe with the tank truck manifold.
Safety At Retails Outlets

Safety measures at Retail Outlets assume important because petroleum products are directly exposed to public. This increases danger due to the presence of varying conditions and can cause serious damage to public life and property in case of accident for smooth end use of the products .it is therefore, essential that safety points are properly followed at hte retails outlets .Safety precautions to be observed by outlets are listed below.

- Adequate number of 10 kg and 4.5 kg CO2 Fire Extinguishers to be provided. Each dispencing unit at RO should be covered with atleast 2 numbers of 10 kg DCP fire extinguishers placed within 3 meter radius.
- Two Nos 4.5 kg Co2 fire Extinguishers near panel room.
- Regular checking of all fire Extinguishers. i.e. every quarter.
- All pump attendants and managers to be fully aware about the operations of Fire Extinguishers.
- Adequate number of sand buckets with dry and clean sand to be available with a lid/Canopy.
- keep tank farm free from oil spillage and dry grass.
- TT decantation through cam lock coupling.
- Use of electrically continuous rubber hose . Plastic hose not to be used under any circumstances.
- Before decantation ensure filling to check list and adhering to safe decantation of TT as per procuder.
- Display of Explosive Licence Number.
- Display of NO SMOKING and 'SWITCH OFF YOUR MOBILE' Baord.
- Display of emergency numbers-like Fire Brigade ,Police, Ambulance, etc.
- Pump island to be cleaned of any spillage or litter.
- Space under dispending pumps to be filled with dry sand.
- No loose wire connections inside the dispendsing pumps.
- No Un-authorized work to be carried out at the retails outlets.
- Yard area and drive way to be cleaned of litter and rubbish like paper scrap, cigarette butts, etc.
-In monsoons, all areas like tank farm, pump island to be especially kapt clean of spilled or stagant oil to avoid escape of oil rain water to public areas.
- Underground space tank to be kept to 2/3 full to avoid ploating especially in areas prone to water logging.
- Additional care is required during festive seasons where hazards from crackers and fire works could threaten safetly at RO.
Do's and Don'ts for Retails Outlets
To be displayed-at Etrance:
- No smoking, NO maked flames inside RO.
- Switch off your Mobile Telephone.
To be Displayed at Pump island/Drive Way:
- No Smoking.
- Switch off Mobile Telephone.
- Stop Engine before refuling
- 2/3 Wheeler to drag their vehicle from Pump Island without starting engine.
- Remove delivery hose from the vehicle after refueling.
- Don't allow leakage/spillage.
- Don't litter in the area.
- Don't use Non Flameproof lights near DU/Tank area.
- Don't move the vehicle while refueling is on.
To be displayed at Ug Tank Area:
- No Smoking.
- Keep all the opening of UG tank lightly closed.
- Keep Air vent free from clogging.
- Ensure Seated Decantation -of TT through electrically continuous hose.
- Ensure proper earthing of TT While Unloading.
- Use bonded Metallic Bucket Sampling.
- Position of 10 kg DCP Fire Extinguisher before start of unloading of TT.
- Ensure Good Hose Keeping.
- Don't Smoke Or Use Maked flame.
- Don't Use Mobile Telephone.
- Don't use Plastic Bucket or-containers for product sampling.
- Don't use plastic hose for TT Decantation.
- Don't use serial lights (used for decoration during festivities)
- Don't allow the entry of the vehicles at decantation area.
To be displayed at Meter Room/Electrical Pannel:
- Test before you touch.
- Display 'Danger' Sing on pannel.
- Use correct rating of HRC fuse .
- Keep the pannel room clean, tidy and well Ventilated.
- Ensure the availability, of 4.5 kg CO2 Fire Extinguisher.
- Don't allow loose wiring/temporary connection in Panel.
- Don't Keep any POL Containers in Panel Room.
- Don't Keep the door of Panel Board Open.
- Don't operate any switch until authorised.
- Don't allow unauthorized person of carry out electrical job.
- Don't use Water or Foam for Extinguishing the Electrical Fire.
